tglkmeans 0.3.5
  • Reference
  • Usage

Simulate normal data for kmeans tests

Source: R/tests.R
simulate_data.Rd

Creates nclust clusters normally distributed around 1:nclust

simulate_data(
  n = 100,
  sd = 0.3,
  nclust = 30,
  dims = 2,
  frac_na = NULL,
  add_true_clust = TRUE
)

Arguments

n

number of observations per cluster

sd

sd

nclust

number of clusters

dims

number of dimensions

frac_na

fraction of NA in the first dimension

add_true_clust

add a column with the true cluster ids

Value

simulated data

Examples

simulate_data(n = 100, sd = 0.3, nclust = 5, dims = 2)
#> # A tibble: 500 x 4
#>   id        V1        V2 true_clust
#> 1  1 1.1984959 0.7455451          1
#> 2  2 0.9952840 0.9674486          1
#> 3  3 0.7552550 1.0635308          1
#> 4  4 0.5372249 0.6594100          1
#> 5  5 1.1364391 1.0301327          1
#> 6  6 0.9001245 1.1462168          1
#> # ... with 494 more rows

# add 20% missing data
simulate_data(n = 100, sd = 0.3, nclust = 5, dims = 2, frac_na = 0.2)
#> # A tibble: 500 x 4
#>   id        V1        V2 true_clust
#> 1  1 0.8524299 1.2092115          1
#> 2  2 0.3598599 0.8121535          1
#> 3  3 0.5694277 0.9026157          1
#> 4  4 1.0418505 1.0769677          1
#> 5  5 0.8804609 0.9241452          1
#> 6  6 0.8968136 1.1140381          1
#> # ... with 494 more rows
